bestBHT.bht: I rejoice that in everything I am of good courage concerning you. Owing to your good conduct, I am (re)-assured by you. The outcome has brought joy, courage, and hope to Paul, inspiring his faith and encouraging him in his ministry. Paul finds confidence in the Corinthians, as they receive his words in good part and he can freely offer reproof, admonition, and advice. Their love and obedience, proven through experience, allow Paul to boast of their faithfulness and speak boldly in their favor.

Henry Alford: I rejoice...that in every thing I am (re)-assured by you."
Am of good courage, in contrast to my former dejection."
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The conclusion is more emphatical without it.
That in everything I am of good courage concerning you.
As contrasted with my former doubts concerning you.
Albert Barnes: No man can be a Christian who voluntarily indulges in sin, or in what he knows to be wrong."
The way to bring people to repentance is to present to them the simple and unvarnished truth.
The great purpose of Christian discipline is to benefit the whole church.
Marvin Vincent: I have confidence in you [θαρρω εν υμιν] . Wrong. Rev., correctly, I am of good courage. In you expresses the ground of his encouragement as lying in them.
Philip Schaff: 2 Corinthians 7:16. I rejoice that in everything I am of good courage concerning you.
Archibald T. Robertson: I am of good courage (θαρρω). The outcome has brought joy, courage, and hope to Paul.
John Gill: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things."
That I can speak freely and boldly to you, reprove, admonish, and advise you, since you take it all in good part, as I design it.
That I can confidently speak in your favour, boast of your love and obedience, which is found upon trial and by experience to be truth.

bhtAttempts.bht: I rejoice that in everything I am of good courage concerning you. Despite his previous dejection, Paul now finds reassurance and confidence in the Corinthians' good conduct. His joy, courage, and hope are strengthened by their actions. Paul is comforted by the fact that he can speak freely and boldly to them, offering reproof, admonition, and advice, as they receive it in good part. He can confidently boast of their love and obedience, which has been proven through experience. Through their example, the Corinthians inspire Paul's faith and encourage him in his ministry.

Through their example, the Corinthians inspire Paul's faith and encourage him in his ministry.
